sub_title: Managing Director, ADCN | Club for Creativity & Co-Founder, PlusPlusOne
summary:
Dinesh (Dutch/Indian) is Managing Director of ADCN | Club for Creativity.

ADCN's mission is creative growth: grow creative people and ideas to make a positive impact on business, culture and society. ADCN's Club & Academy programs include include talks, workshops, masterclasses, courses, labs, challenges, mentorships. Every year, ADCN organizes the Dutch Creativity Awards and Dutch Creativity Festival. ADCN was founded in 1966 and is a non-profit educational platform and community.

Dinesh combines a background in economics and strategy with a passion for culture and entrepreneurship. His experience includes strategic management at IMD in Switzerland, brand management for Heineken in Central Africa and The Netherlands, and design management with frog in India and the EU. He is a founding team member of THNK School of Creative Leadership and the founder of Banyan Tree, an agency for creativity, strategy and innovation.

At THNK he co-founded the Saaf India Foundation – creating innovative and sustainable solutions for waste in India’s public spaces. Together with Circle Economy he founded Circular Brands, a program aimed to speed up the transition to the circular economy through brand communications and innovations.

Dinesh has led workshops at festivals like India Design Forum, Ashoka India Future Forum, INK Conference (TED India) and What Design Can Do. His work has been featured in Stanford Social Innovation Review and India Today. In 2013 he was awarded a scholarship for the executive program in social entrepreneurship at Stanford's Graduate School of Business and in 2018 he was awarded the Coq d'Honneur for his contributions to marketing communications in the Netherlands. He is a Board Member of +PlusOne, an accelerator program that brings underrepresented talent into the creative and media industry. Dinesh also works for the Dutch Marketing Diversity foundation and supports his local tennis club with ideas for the future.

He enjoys tennis, street photography, creative writing, graphic design, jazz and the books of PG Wodehouse.
